{"step_by_step_thinking": "First, I need to identify which cements have the ability to bond with the tooth. From Document [0], I can see that GIC (Glass Ionomer Cement) has the ability to bond with the tooth. Document [1] mentions that polycarboxylate cement is considered the most biocompatible type due to having the most rapid pH rise, which suggests it can bond with the tooth. Document [6] also mentions that Zinc polycarboxylate cements adhere to enamel and dentine. Therefore, the two cements which hold with the tooth are GIC and polycarboxylate.", "answer_choice": "A"}
